item.title: Atkin Building
item.description:
4 Gray's Inn Place, London WC1R 5DX

How do I get to The City Law School?

  • Tube: The nearest underground stations are Holborn on the Piccadilly and Central lines and Chancery Lane on the Central Line.
  • Bus: Routes 8, 17, 19, 25, 38, 45, 46, 55, 59, 68, 91, 98, 168, 171, 188, 242, 243, 341, 501, 521.
  • Car: Parking in the roads surrounding The City Law School is at parking meters. The nearest National Car Parks to The City Law School are Selkirk House, Museum Street or International Press Centre, Shoe Lane. Please note that The City Law School is within the Congestion Charging Zone.

106 Bunhill Row,
London, EC1Y 8TZ
UK

It houses:

  • Career Resource Centre
  • Cyril Kleinwort Library
  • Specialist Master's Programme
  • MBA courses

item.title: Career and Skills Development Service
item.description:
The Career and Skills Development Service provides a professional, high quality Career and Information Service for students and recent graduates of City, in collaboration with employers and other university academic and service departments. Our aim is to support and develop our students by providing the tools to enhance employability skills.

Careers Centre Opening Times

Day Opening Times
Monday 09:00 to 17:00
Tuesday 09:00 to 17:00
Wednesday 09:00 to 17:00
Thursday 10:30 to 17:00
Friday 09:00 to 17:00

item.title: Cass Learning Resource Centre
item.description:
Specialist business collections and library services dedicated to students of Cass Business School.

Cass Learning Resource Centre is based on the first floor of Bunhill Row. The library primarily supports Postgraduate students whilst Undergraduate collections are based at the University Library, Northampton Square.

A dedicated team of professional staff are available to assist you with using our comprehensive portfolio of electronic resources and with finding books for your course.

For more information about our facilities and services, please contact us or visit our website.

item.title: Centenary Building
item.description:
Entrance on Spencer Street, also accessible through the main University Building in Northampton Square.

It houses:

  • Birley lecture theatre
  • Oakden lecture theatre
  • Poynton lecture theatre
  • Geary lecture theatre.

item.title: City Law School (Gray's Inn Place)
item.description:
Specialist legal collections and library services dedicated to law students on professional programmes based at Gray's Inn Place.

The City Law School has two dedicated law libraries. The library at Gray's Inn Place primarily supports students on professional programmes while law students based at Northampton Square have the use of a law collection on level 4 of the University library, Northampton Square.

A dedicated team of professional staff, qualified in law librarianship and trained in legal research are available to assist you with sourcing legal materials, researching the law and answering your queries.

For more information about our law libraries, our facilities and services, please:

  • contact our Enquiry Desk on +44 (0) 20 7400 3605
  • read our guide to resources for Law
  • or take a look at our legal resource portals, Lawbore and Lawbore Professional

item.title: College Building
item.description:
College Building lies on St John Street, adjacent to City's main Northampton Square site.

It houses:

  • School of Arts (Department of Journalism, Department of Creative Practice and Enterprise)
  • School of Informatics (Department of Computing, Department of Information Science, Centre for Software Reliability, Centre for Human Computer Interaction Design, Centre for Health Informatics)
  • College common room.

item.title: College Building A220
item.description:
Capacity

35 PCs

Facilities

  • Whiteboard
  • Air conditioning

item.title: College Building A307
item.description:
Type

Centrally managed computer room

Capacity

16 computers

A307 and A308 are joined by a moveable partition, to allow for a computer room of 48. Please ask timetabling if you require both rooms at the time of booking.

Facilities

  • Teaching Pod (including PC, DVD/VHS/CD/cassette player and visualiser)
  • Whiteboard

item.title: Drysdale Building
item.description:
Drysdale Building lies on Spencer Street, behind City's main Northampton Square site and next to Centenary Building. It is directly accessible only though the main University Building in Northampton Square.

It houses:

  • Cass Business School (Undergraduate)
  • Career & Skills Development Centre
  • Cash Office
  • Health Centre
  • Student Counselling
  • IT Service Centre
  • PC Labs
  • Drysdale Lecture Theatre
  • CRIDO
  • Saad Centre
  • Drysdale Garden.

item.title: Alexandra Building (School of Health Sciences)
item.description:
CLOSURE OF WHITECHAPEL BUILDING
Just a reminder to all students that the School's Whitechapel Building is no longer open. Library facilities are available at West Smithfield and Northampton Square.

Full information can be found on Moodle

Alexandra Building, Philpot Street, London E1 2EA

Travel

  • Tube: The nearest underground station is Whitechapel on the District, Hammersmith and City and East London lines
  • Bus: Routes 25, 106, 205, 253
  • Car: Parking in the roads surrounding the Whitechapel site is at parking meters only. The Whitechapel site for School of Health Sciences is outside the Congestion Charging Zone.

item.title: Students' Union
item.description: The Students' Union is located next to the University's main entrance at Northampton Square. You will be able to access the Union Support Service (to book an appointment about academic issues with a student adviser) and speak to staff about any queries you may have about sports, clubs and societies. You will also be able to purchase NUS Extra cards.

item.title: Tait Building
item.description:
The Tait Building is located in Northampton Square and is bordered by Spencer Street and Goswell Street. It sits next to University Building as part of City's main Northampton Square site. It is directly accessible through the University Building.

It houses:

  • School of Engineering & Mathematical Sciences
  • School of Health Sciences
  • Oliver Thompson lecture theatre.

item.title: University Building
item.description:
Northampton Square, London EC1V 0HB, United Kingdom | +44 (0)20 7040 5060

University Building sits at the centre of the main Northampton Square site. It provides the main entrance to the University.

It houses:

  • Library Services
  • Student Centre
  • Main Reception
  • Security Office
  • Student Refectory

item.title: University Library
item.description:
The main University Library at Northampton Square provides printed resources, study spaces, networked PCs and wireless internet access across five floors.

Study spaces

The library offers a range of innovative study spaces for students wishing to study individually or work collaboratively with colleagues.

Our study floors are clearly identified as either Group Study or Silent Study areas.  Please familiarise yourself with the Information Services Code of Conduct and the local guidelines displayed around the study floors.

Services

Books can be borrowed and returned at our self-service counter on level 2.  This floor also houses our 24 hour loan collection in a dedicated space adjacent to the main service desk. In addition, we have self-service machines located on level 5, in close proximity to the main book collection.

Vending machines to purchase and top up Copycards, for our photocopying machines, and add credit to your print account are located on level 2.

Assistance with library access and registration is offered at the Service Desk on level 2 during staffed hours.  Our staff will also be happy to assist if you need to collect a reserved item, pick up and InterLibrary loan or store request or pay a library fine.

Computers

 There are over 100 networked computers in the library. Approximately 50 are located on level 2 and 3 with additional computers in the Law Library computer lab.

Photocopying and printing

Photocopiers are located on levels 2, 3, 4 and 5 of the library within easy reach of stock.
To use the photocopiers, you should obtain a copycard.

A Copycard dispenser and recharging machines are located on level 2 of the library.

Your printing account is linked to your IT user account.

Printers are located on levels 2, 3 and in the Law Library computer lab. Kiosks to add credit to your printing account are located on level 2 of the library and in the IT Service Centre (room E101, Drysdale Building).  The kiosks accept cash and card payments.
